title: Puss in Boots: The Last Wish
description: Puss in Boots discovers that his passion for adventure has taken its toll: He has burned through eight of his nine lives, leaving him with only one life left. Puss sets out on an epic journey to find the mythical Last Wish and restore his nine lives.

reviews.text: Puss in Boots is a very good Action Adventure film.  Some negative criticism comes from people who label it a Comedy and in turn to find out it's not bursting at the seams with laughter.  More like the chuckles are spread out little by little throughout the film which I did enjoy. If you do not compare this film directly to the Shrek movies, which bombards you with jokes and such, then I believe you will enjoy this movie more.    Another thing that stems negativity is that people believe there is too much adult humor for a children's movie.  That tells me that there are some people still out there that believe all cartoons are for kids, which is not the case.  Included are underlying mature themes that, I believe, is done tastefully.  Very good movie and highly recommended.
Very Well DoneThis Is The Story That Puss Needed, And It Doesn't Disappoint.
It's not one of the year's best, but it certainly is the year's most enjoyable return of Puss.

Ever since Puss in Boots (Antonio Banderas) showed his adorable face and fighting spirit in Shrek 2, it was only going to be a matter of time before he got his own movie. Puss in Boots is simple, innocent, and takes the audience on a wild, adventurous journey from Spanish towns to the Giantâ

Sharp, witty fun, this 'Shrek' spin-off is loads of fun. Personally, I found Puss to be a more enjoyable character than Shrek (I was a never a huge fan of the Shrek movies) and the cast is wonderful (especially Banderas). Animation is superb and the 3-D definitely adds to the experience (can't say that too often!). Kids will love it, highly recommended.

Haha, what's there to say that's bad about this movie? From the start of the Shrek series, Puss was obviously that character everyone loved. With the smoothness of Antonio Banderas' voice with the hilarious actions of Puss on the screen, makes this movie great. See this movie.

Fully entertaining for both the kids and adults, but it does not live up to the wit standards of the best of this class (like the original Shrek).   Still, better than anything else in the family genre in the last few months.

Puss in Boots is very good spin-off and I enjoy this movie with great expectations to see it. First of, the story takes place were Puss becomes a legendary cat before he meets Shrek until later. Puss joins Humptey Dumptey and Kitty Softpaws to find the magic beans from the evil Jack and Jill and they must work each other as a team to get the golden eggs at the top of the clouds more like from the fairy tale of  "Jack and the Beanstalk." Next, we meet the characters from the movie. Antonio Banderas returns the voice as "Puss in Boots", Salma Hayek voice as "Kitty Softpaws", Zack Galifianakis voice as "Humptey Alexander Dumptey", and of course "Jack & Jill" was voice by Billy Bob Thornton and Amy Sedaris. Those characters are fun to watch and they did pretty well such as Banderas and Hayek since they team up in "Desperado." Most importantly, the animation was wonderful and I saw this movie once again in 3D. It's very beautiful and I can see the background that the 3D could take you anywhere and its done well since the animation brings 3D to see. In my opinion, this movie was fun, swashbuckling, and funny at the same time and this cat was awesome!

Fantastic graphic and action scenes. An ultimate catgasm. What's not to like? I like the fact that the role of Humpty Dumpty is included in this movie. Very well done. Although, I would like to know more about Humpty Dumpty's origin in this movie. Expectation fulfilled :D

'' Puss in Boots '' is a good, fun, enjoyable movie to see, especially with your kids, if you have one. I like the fact that it doesn't rely with the Shrek movies. What I mean is that you don't have to see any Shrek movie to understand this film. The creators had done a terrific job developing the character Puss in boots's (his origins, etc). All the other characters were great. Every actor's voice matched perfectly with their character. Of course, we all know Antonio Banderas (as Puss in Boots), but even Zach Galifianakis (as Humpty Dumpty) and Salma Hayek (as Kitty Softpaws) did a wonderful job. The comic moments were cleaver, and they all had the perfect timing (essential in comedy). It also has that Mexican style, with the songs and all that. It funny for me, because in this movie (including Shrek) they make fun of fairy tales. So the creators put all type of stereotypes and representation for each fairy tale character (like Puss in boots is Spanish). This movie didn't lose that sort of '' humor ''. A thing that I founded interesting was, in some scenes, they splited the screens, to show different places at the same time. They made fun of that, which was cool. In general, it's enjoyable movie, worth a watch.

PIB astounded me not only with his voice but with his connection with Softpaws.  They've got to create an award for voice actor duets because A.B. and S.H. sparked a bonfire of joy like they did in the movie Desperado; where they actually had a moment of gratification in bed.

A fun, light-hearted romp throug the origins and adventures of Puss in Boots (the infamous feline from the Shrek series). I found the story to be much more engaging than expected. As always with Dreamworks the animation was spot on, and the venues in which this adventures took place were gorgeously rendered and varied as well. Many laughable moments are in store for anyone in the mood for some very subtle humor. Recommended for anyone with a heart for animation, adventure, and of course, cats!

This movie was just plain fun. Not as good as the first two shreks but better than the third and fourth. This movie was hilariois. Antonio Banderas does such a great job voicing Puss in boots. Absolutely hilarious. And Zach Galifinakis was very good as Humpy. I loved this movie, very fun and adventurous movie. 8/10

Fully entertaining for both the kids and adults, but it does not live up to the wit standards of the best of this class (like the original Shrek). Still, better than anything else in the family genre in the last few months.

Puss in Boots is another entertaining Dreamworks animated movie. Puss in Boots was what I expected - interesting characters, some great laughs (including the Shrek-like humor for adults only), and an interesting backstory. Unfortunately, no cameos from major Shrek characters. The star of the movie was definitely Banderas's Puss. If you liked the character from previous movies, you will not be disappointed. Salma Hayak as Kitty Softpaws was decent enough although not very memorable in any way. And finally, Zach Galifianakis's Humpty Dumpty will be a polarizing character in my opinion. If you thought Rumpelstiltskin from Shrek Forever After was a tad on the annoying side, I think you'll feel the same way about Humpty Dumpty.. Anyways, the story is good. The integration of former players in nursery rhymes and fairy tales is seamless. And the comedy is standard Shrek-style delivering lots of laughs for children and the occasional adult-only joke. The visuals are stunning. And the music is fantastic. It almost felt like an action-packed spaghetti western with a Latin flavor. I definitely enjoyed myself. I also talked to quite a few people afterwords and the consensus was that the children all loved it and the adults kept using the word "cute" in so many different ways to describe their feelings about the movie.

Besides being an occasional pleaser for non-fans, "Puss in Boots" will definitely entertain followers of the franchise, with the backstory of the titular character being told in a silly, and sometimes breathtaking, adventure. The film retains an annoyingly static amount of interest, sometimes plummeting, and suffers a lack of taste and dignity at other times. Unexpectedly though, there is a strong point in the writing, where there are scenes in the story that give hints to what will happen next without making the predictable boring. The action, travel and fight scenes are a definite treat; the film features top-notch animation of scenery. At the very least, seeing the movie will satisfy people's want to know Puss's story, and that enough makes it watchable and gives the watcher something to remember it by, but of course no one could forget Antonio Banderas's majestic portrayal of Puss. Final score: 78/100

besides me loving cats i really fount the trailer quite funny and i was Intrigued to know more and its amazing i did not expect it one bit and it was better than my expectaions from now puss in boots is an aboslute legend and its funny.

Puss in boots is so cute and funny, i liked him when he was in Shrek and i did find him a lot more interesting than Shrek because he was so cute and funny. I liked the film a lot but i didn't think the quality was as good as it could be :)

This is obviously the BEST animated movie of the year by far. The story is GREAT, the animation is just AMAZING,  The only teeny tiny bad thing that is why I am giving it a 9 not a 10 is that there should be more characters like in Shrek.

I had low expectations of this spin off film as it's lead character was little but light comic relief in the Shrek series, Well colour me pleasantly surprised then as the picture easily holds it's own against it's green counterpart. It's a fun jaunt deeper into the universe Dreamworks created for Shrek and the trip is a worthwhile one. A suitable amount of jokes for the young ones and a selection that will fly right over their heads for the rest of us. Take the kids and unlike most of the films you take them to you'll never find yourself yawning.
This has got to be the best animated movie ever. It's cute, funny, and just plain addictive. Especially if you are a cat person! Certainly, can't wait for another one.I give it a billion paws up!
Amei esse filme ele é realmente muito bom mesmo maravilhosamente ótimo.  J
All I Can Is "THE BEST MOVIE OF 2011 & CD ANIMATION" ITS FULL OF LAUGHS AND CRYS....ITS AMAZING TRY TO SEE IT IN 3D!

Unwatchable. This is what spin-offs are. Dreamworks wasn't content with 4 Shreks, they had to spin-off a sword-wielding feline. Alas, we get a **** version of Zorro - voiced by Zorro himself - complete with enough cat jokes and cutaways to milk-sopping to make me a dog-lover for life. Pixar is the unquestioned leader in animation not because of their animation so much as their storytelling ability and their integrity (i.e. not letting a mediocre spin-off tarnish their name). Miss this and go take in "Toy Story 3" for the 4th time.

Mediocre cartoon. Too much adult humor. Too many things were just plain ridiculous. There are a lot of better kids movies. I think cars 2 was better than this movie and I disliked cars 2 as well. If you want to see Puss n Boots in a movie, just go watch Shrek, Shrek was good.

Your first question should be "What do I expect from this Movie?"  That makes a difference.  I think the humor was just enough to entertain, and the storyline was just enough to entertain.  This movie brought a little more than I expected...a biography, of sorts, of Puss in Boots.   The 3D effect wasn't mind-blowing, at all.  For me, the movie was entertaining and delivered enough to have me feel at the end that my $9.50 for the experience was worth it.  Once.

I enjoyed the first 20 minutes or so, but once the quest for the eggs begins it starts to really drag. I was pleasantly surprised that there were no Shrek tie-ins or references and the Sergio Leone and Quentin Tarantino homages were well done. All in all, not horrible, but certainly not the best animated film of the year.

The addition of the Humpty Dumpty character is a mistake and leaves Puss to carry the entire film. Puss in Boots, though entertaining, is a missed opportunity indeed.
The Dark Knight Rises is the best movie ever I have ever seen in the movie and I haven’t seen it yet but I don’t think I can feel it like that i only thing ever
Chris Millerâ

For a film that did not need to exist Puss and Boots turned out ok. It took a different take on the Shrek world and gave us a decent action/adventure flick. While it times it can be fun and charming some slow parts and the lack of much for an older audience hold it back from being spectacular. However, the films action and adventure feel and somewhat unpredictable story, at least for me, make it a bit better than Shrek 4. If you are looking for something to show the kids that is fun and family friendly, excluding some subtle adult humor, Puss in Boots not a bad rent just do not expect to go gag a over it the way your kids will.

Better then the third and fourth Shrek movies, and just as excellent as Puss's first appearance in Shrek 2! I never expected to see Humpty Dumpty go from being a random fairy tale character to a rather tragic character.
As a cat lover I felt I couldn

Funny and enjoyable, also a good way to bring back Puss in Boots, some of the humor can be a little inappropriate so don't let the very young ones see, but if your looking for a good rental and like DreamWorks previous movies then this is a good choice.
From the reviews I seen, I didn't exactly have high hopes. But I actually had fun watching this movie. If a sequel came, I would watch it definitely.
Puss in Boots is funny, eye-catching animation but somewhat missing. "Adult entertainment." It's for the kids, really work, but don't bring a date. It lacks of emotion.

Excellent spin off, good fun for adults and kids.  Was the first cinema trip my 18 month had ever had, and he actually sat still for the majority of it, which says something!  Superb animation, great voices and humour, just a lovely fairytale.

Thought this was good fun, but not nearly as good as it could have been. The Puss in Boots character is a great hero with fantastic comedy value but the lame villain and simplistic and predictable plot let it down.

Puss in Boots May not be Dreamworks best Animation but its definitely not  bad . Puss in Boots is no where near Shrek 1 or 2 but its better then shrek 3 & 4. Characters impression was very impressive . Animation was Very good. Story was average ! The bean and the tree part was great but the ending was a bit shallow .  The story set in the western area doesn't go well for an Animation Movie . Though Puss in Boots was funny but it had some boring part. I did expected a lot more but it didn't disappointed me much !

Coming into this movie I expected to a childish bore feast. I was amazed by how good this movie was. It had action, humor, and a good ending. So take it from me a 17 year old this movie is for everybody not just kiddies.

The story may be a bit silly, but is very good and unpredictable for a cartoon. The ending is surprising and may leave you thinking for the rest of the night "what the hell". It is funny, too.   *look to the sides* OOOOOOH!
Puss in Boots feels like Shrek 4. Both movies had great visuals and good action, but their stories felt somewhat empty. Puss in Boots however, does have a slightly better ending than Shrek 4.
Better than the recent shrek films, has good animation and decent humour. Not bad.

I've been expecting much more than what I've seen. If you have watched the trailer, then you can notice that all the jokes were in it (that is to say ... 3 jokes !), so it's a serious failure for what is to be a comedy movie. Apart from that, the storyline didn't blow my mind, yet it was rather good entertainment. Oh and I was about to forget : I don't think Puss in Boots is cute, but this is just my personal point of view ! When the movie is released in France, I won't bother spending around 8â

Funny, and Clever. May not be as good as Shrek, but it gets up somewhere. The idea was as good as i expected, dialog was good as well, but the many Cat puns had me shaking my head. if only they Tried to take more of a Subtle Adult humor take, instead of plainly childish.

Puss does not disappoint.  They have added a nice collection of secondary characters to allow the Puss to do his thing.  End plays out a bit like a Twilight Zone episode,  and might leave a few young ones a bit shocked.

I thought it had a great story and was funny.Loved the cat that would cover his month and say ooohhhh every time they would kiss.got a little weird with the whole bean stock thing but over all I thought was good.

this movie is about a journey there is Humpty Dumpty(the brains) puss in boots(the aggressive) and Kitty Softpaws(the skills) that's what makes it a great movie, plus the jokes and excitement definitely go see this movie
A few jokes meant for adults. Very stylish with the Spanish theme. Loved the way Zach Galifianakis portrayed Humptey. This is better for me than Shrek 2.
